com.alohar.core
Class Alohar

java.lang.Object
  com.alohar.core.Alohar

public class Alohar
extends java.lang.Object

Interface to global information about Alohar SDK's environment It manages the life cycle of alohar core service, register and authenticate client access, and access of major service components:

  • Place Manager ALPlaceManager
  • Motion Manager ALMotionManager

To use the SDK, the Alohar needs to be properly initialized by calling Alohar.init(Application Context) during the start time of application. After that, you can get the Alohar instance by Alohar.getInstance().

Version:
0.1
Author:
jianmingzhou

register

public void register(int appId,
                     java.lang.String apiKey,
                     ALEventListener callback)
Registers a new alohar user internally and return a UID to communicate with Alohar server later.

Parameters:
appId - App ID from Alohar for registered App.
apiKey - ApiKey of the App
callback - event = {ALEvents.REGISTRATION_CALLBACK, data = UID (string)} if success, otherwise, even = {ALEvents.GENERAL_ERROR_CALLBACK or ALEvents.SERVER_ERROR_CALLBACK, data = error message}
Since:
v0.1

authenticate

public void authenticate(java.lang.String UID,
                         int appId,
                         java.lang.String apiKey,
                         ALEventListener callback)
Authenticates an existing user and return its UID to communicate with Alohar server later.

Parameters:
UID - a unique id assigned to a user from Alohar server. 3rd party application shall properly manage the mapping between its user and UID.
appId - App ID from Alohar for registered App.
apiKey - ApiKey of the app
callback - event = {ALEvents.AUTHENTICATE_CALLBACK, data = UID (string)} if success, otherwise, even = {ALEvents.GENERAL_ERROR_CALLBACK or ALEvents.SERVER_ERROR_CALLBACK, data = error message}
Since:
v0.1

logout

public void logout()
Resets user account

Since:
v0.1
